techmeme.title: As Trump targets Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan, a look at his VC firm Walden International, which has invested $5B+ in 600+ companies, with 100+ in China including SMIC (Ian King/Bloomberg)
Analysis: 12 Chinese tech companies have applied to list in Hong Kong so far this year, the most since 2023, after rules allowed lossmaking companies to float (Financial Times)
Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan tells employees the company is engaging with the Trump administration to address concerns about him and "ensure they have the facts" (Lip-Bu Tan/Intel)
Decart, which offers real-time generative video and GPU optimization tech to cloud providers and AI companies, raised a $100M Series B at a $3.1B valuation (Duncan Riley/SiliconANGLE)
Bit Digital-owned AI infrastructure company WhiteFiber closed down 4.59% in its Nasdaq debut, after raising $159.4M in an IPO, valuing the company at $619M (Bloomberg)
